intro: Paramignya longispina, commonly known as the long-spined paramignya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and are clustered in inflorescences. Paramignya longispina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
